WorkItem.Description:
I noticed that, for my current gear set, Rawr seems to be valuing Mastery over Dodge. This is happening on the MT model, OT model and on the optimizer.
 
Since the Savage Defense nerf, I keep hearing that mastery is not so good anymore, and that dodge is much better, but not Rawr is telling me otherwise. The only possible explanation I can see for it is diminishing returns. Anyone got any idea for this ? Here is some of my char data, hoping it will help (this data is post-optimizer):
 
Dodge: 34.326%
Miss: 6.4%
Armor Damage Reduction: 53.405%
Total Damage Reduction: 66.787%
Avoidance PreDR: 43.768%
Avoidance PostDR: 40.726%
Savage Defense: 67.002% ~ 20086
Total Mitigation: 88.505%
Damage Take: 11.485%

Comments.Message: Why are you still using 4.0.12? We are on 4.0.14. I'm guessing you are using Chrome and need to Force Refresh the page (Shift+F5).
Sorry, my bad. I'm actually using 4.0.14. I have no idea why I wrote 4.0.12. I'm editing the title to match.

Simply put, it's all the stamina you're stacking.

Or rather, the agility you're *not* stacking. Avoidance scales with avoidance, so your avoidance is low enough that more avoidance isn't better.

Did you check both item sets on the xml file, Astrylian ? I mean, even the optimized one still have 1 +101 stam gem, but it is more agility oriented. Not, of course, as much as you would like, since I did put HP >= 160000 on the optimizer to make my healers happy (and yes, I know they are wrong, but it is a lost fight, since the raid leader is one of the healers), but still the minimum I could get away with.
In any case, I think I get your point. I will try running a few models without any stamina and see if I get a better feeling of what is happening. I will let you know here how that turns out.

Looks like I will have to wait for better gear (late T11 maybe, or T11.5). I just run the optimizer with no requirements (no hit, no exp, no health), for all the gear I have available right now, and I'm still getting Mastery.
I am, however, getting agility as my priority, which I agree wholeheartedly.
If you want to leave this issue open, I will report back here if I see anything different.
Don't forget the flask. You should never ever under any circumstances use the Steelskin flask right now. It's bugged underpowered.
Thank you Astrylian. I had a feeling about that flask, but was not certain. Now I know. Will work on that.

I'm still having no success getting dodge to be valued more than agility. I changed flask, enchants, and even made some items available (well, actually, 1 trinket), and the optimizer still gives me mastery for reforging. I'm attacking a new XML with the changes I've made, and the results I've got (just 1 item set, with the results).
Astrylian, is it still a matter of not enough agility ? (Meaning, I won't get dodge until I get a lot more gear)
Same result with 4.0.15b. Updating the title.

Ok, there is something really odd. Following the suggestions from the EJ forums [1], I went on the options tab and set threat to 0 (None). After that, even after setting the other values on the optimizer as I usually do, I've got the expected results (dodge instead of mastery).
I have no idea how threat could influence something like that, but it did. Also, interestingly enough, neither before (threat = MT) nor after (threat = NONE) I did any kind of configuration regarding threat on the optimizer. My only parameter was "Avoided Interrupts % <= 0".
Uploading "morcego_bear-4", with the Threat None setting and the result of the optimizer.
The problem seems fixed on 4.0.16b. Was it really a bug ? I didn't change any gear between 4.0.15b and 4.0.16b.
